title: Guest Service Agent
description: POSITION DESCRIPTION POSITION TITLE: Member Experience Specialist (MES) REPORTS TO: Member Experience Lead DIRECT REPORTS: N/A FLSA STATUS: Non-Exempt, Hourly COMPENSATION: Base rate is $11.40 per hour + Commission eligibility! JOIN OUR TEAM At VASA Fitness, we want to create an uplifting experience for everyone by offering inclusive, accessible, and on-trend fitness. The foundation of our brand is rooted in a culture centered on unity, passion, love, integrity, fun, and trust. Because our culture is alive-embodied by members and team members alike-VASA is a place where lives are changed because of authentic connections made within our supportive community. We offer a competitive, all-encompassing benefits package which includes healthcare benefits for employees who work 20+ hours per week. All employees receive two complimentary gym memberships-one for themselves and another to give away-plus 401k options. 30+ hours per week employees:Paid Time Off (hourly),Health, Dental, Vision Benefits and Paid Parental Leave (in addition to above) 40 hours per week employees:Flexible Vacation Plan (salary) & Paid Holidays (in addition to above) Come join VASA Fitness and join a passionate, fun, and united team! PURPOSE The Member Experience Specialist is responsible for delivering a fun and meaningful experience to our members and guests every visit. This includes greeting our members in a friendly manner, creating personal connections with them, ensuring problems are reported in a timely manner, organizing equipment, and keeping the club sparkling clean. This is accomplished through the execution of our operational standards. The MES team is responsible for creating a great first impression of VASA Fitness, selling memberships, driving upgrades, and touring guests and members around the gym. DELIVERABLES Operational Responsibilities: Commitment to Delivering a Fun and Meaningful Guest and Member Experience: Demonstrates a genuine, kind attitude when interacting with Guests and Members. MES are expected to greet guests and members with a smile, eye contact, and courteous tone. MES should be able to anticipate guest and member needs and respond accordingly by providing clear direction, accurate information, and support through our tools and technology. MES staff should be familiar with our membership plans, pricing, amenities, add-on options, and class formats. MES will provide club tours, sell memberships, help members upgrade, book personal training consultations, and sign members up for personal training. An MES should consistently find ways to improve the Guest and Member experience by sharing member feedback with leadership and collaborate with their team to implement ideas. Upholds VASA Operational Standards:An MES should execute their daily responsibilities to VASA's high standards, which is done by following guest and member check-in processes and procedures, completing daily cleaning and hourly club walks, restocking merchandise, and processing REVIVE sales. Requirements: COMPETENCIES Strong verbal communication skills Demonstrates Professionalism- Is punctual, and professional in appearance. Comfortable with Multitasking Can work with minimal supervision. Results Focused Unquestionable personal code of ethics and integrity QUALIFICATIONS 1 yr. + Customer Service in retail, restaurants or in person-based service industry preferred. 1 yr.+ working with and contributing to the success of a team. Personal interest in health, wellness, fitness, and nutrition. Bilingual preferred (but not required) CPR preferred (but not required) Must be able to pass a background check. This position description intends to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. It is not intended to include all duties and responsibilities. The order in which duties and responsibilities are listed is not significant. VASA Fitness is an Equal Opportunity Employer Compensation: $11.40-$15.40 per hour

title: Customer Service Representative
description: Job Summary The Customer Service Representative will be responsible for creating a positive member experience by providing a superior level of customer service to Planet Fitness members, prospective members and guests. Essential Duties and Responsibilities Customer Service Representative greets members, prospective members and guests, providing exceptional customer service. Handle all front desk related activities including:Answer phones in a friendly manner and assist callers with a variety of questions. Check members into the system.New member sign-up.Take prospective members on tours. Facilitate needed updates to member’s accounts. Respond to member questions and concerns in a timely and professional manner and elevate to Assistant Manager or Manager as needed. Assist in maintaining the neatness and cleanliness of the club. Qualifications/Requirements Customer service background preferred. Basic computer proficiency. A passion for fitness and health. Upbeat and positive attitude! Punctuality and reliability is a must. Exceptional customer service skills; able to interact in a positive and professional way with members and co-workers, exceeding the member’s expectations. Strong listener with the ability to empathize and problem solve. Demonstrate diplomacy in all interactions while using appropriate behavior and language. Must be 18 years of age or older. Physical Demands Continual standing and walking during shift. Continual talking in person or on the phone during shift. Must be able to occasionally lift up to 50 lbs. Will occasionally encounter toxic chemicals during shift. Other Employee Recognition Program Advancement Opportunities Check us out on LinkedIn at: Planet Fitness - PF Baseline Fitness Job Types: Full-time, Part-time Pay: From $14.50 per hour Benefits: Dental insurance Flexible schedule Health insurance Vision insurance Shift: Day shift Evening shift Morning shift Weekly day range: Monday to Friday Weekends as needed Work setting: In-person Work Location: In person

title: Gym Director - Movement Golden
description: Job DetailsDescriptionAt Movement, our core values of partnership, inclusion, passion, innovation, and integrity are at the heart of everything we do. We're not just a climbing gym - we're a community that's dedicated to transforming lives through climbing, yoga, and fitness and sharing that vision with as many people as we can. As the country’s largest network of climbing gyms, with facilities in California, Colorado, Illinois, Maryland, Oregon, Texas, and D.C., we're building an extraordinary team that's committed to growing our business, our value to our members, our future customers, and our industry.By expanding our community, we can create rewarding career paths for our team members, continually improve the customer experience, build a sustainable business for the long term, and give back to the communities we are all a part of. We’re looking for passionate, resilient, and business-minded enthusiasts who share our values and want to join us in not only leading the climbing industry but defining it!Job SummaryThe gym leadership team is comprised of the Gym Director and Assistant Gym Director. As a team, they are responsible for ensuring that the gym functions smoothly, all staff are supported and upholding our Core Values and that we are providing an excellent customer experience.The Gym Director will report to the Sr. Director. They will work with this person to establish goals for the gym and use them as a resource for the growth of their respective gym.The ideal candidate will have a balance of great customer service and leadership skills, as well as excellent administrative abilities. Proven success in developing and managing a high performing team in a fast-paced environment and the ability to see the big picture as well as the everyday details are essential to being a successful gym director. We’re looking for someone who can be part of a highly collaborative team, but also think and execute independently.Job ResponsibilitiesProvides leadership and direction to all climbing center staff in alignment with our mission, vision and values.Recruits, hires, develops, and mentors service-oriented, collaborative, passionate team made up of gym leaders, and operational staff including yoga and fitness staff.Oversees facility operations including maintenance, cleanliness, routes, retail, programming, and community events.Initiates and implements processes, protocols, and procedures to ensure the gym runs in an effective and service-oriented manner while meeting financial goals.Ensures the team is supported and through them, the gym runs smoothly: all administrative needs are met, all staff are well-trained, and our members and guests’ experiences are awesome.Works proactively to build relationships in the community to drive membership growth and retention.Leads by example and participates in front of house gym operations as part of a rotating management schedule.Job Requirements Experience running a fast-paced, high volume business , with a large, multi-departmental team. Knowledge of climbing center operations including retail, routes and programming.Demonstrated relationships within the climbing community and the ability to leverage those relationships to build a strong community in the gym.Excellent communication skills and customer service abilities.Embodies the mission, vision and values and able to foster this sense of culture in all staff.Ability to build a strong staff community, hold accountability to expectations, and develop future leaders.Ability to work independently and juggle competing priorities.Ability to solve problems and handle difficult situations with sound judgment.Proficient in organizational tools such as web-based applications, MS Office and POS tools.Passionate individual who is eager to integrate and build the local climbing community. Schedule & PresenceAbility to provide consistent presence in gym by working from gym daily.Largely works a weekday schedule, including regular presence during weeknight peak hours, with a rotation of weekend presence. Ability to flex schedule to attend events or gym needs.Uses their gym regularly for climbing, working out and yoga, including during peak hours such as weeknights and weekends.Additional InformationFull-time, salary positionThe starting annual salary for this position ranges from $50k to $85k. Actual pay rate will vary based on a candidate's location, qualifications, skills and experience.Paid time offHealth benefits and retirement plan availableFree gym membershipMovement is an Equal Opportunity Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status or marital status. Applications are now open for this position.

title: Gym Attendant
description: Insight Institute of Neuroscience & Neurosurgery (IINN) aims to advance, challenge, and revolutionize neurosciences and medicine through scientific research and advanced technology, driven by a passion to help others regardless of any obstacles and challenges that may lie ahead. Our integrated team of medical professionals does so through creative, innovative techniques and care principles developed because of our continuous pursuit to improve the field of medicine. Our integrated team works together to find solutions to both common and complex medical concerns to ensure more powerful, reliable results. Having multiple specialties “under one roof” Insight achieves its purpose in providing a comprehensive, collaborative approach to neuromusculoskeletal care and rehabilitation to ensure optimal results. Our singular focus is Patient Care Second to None!Job Summary:Insight is seeking a Gym Attendant who will kindly greet all incoming customers, and direct them in-person or by the phone to the proper areas to maximize their customer experience. This person will ensure that the flow of customers moves smoothly and will maintain a neat and clean work area at all times. The Gym Attendant will also check members in and out, answer incoming calls in a friendly manner, complete Point-Of-Sale transactions, fold towels and laundry as needed, regularly monitor our sports equipment, and assist with other basic membership duties as needed.Insight Employees are required to be vaccinated for COVID-19 as a condition of employment, subject to accommodation for medical or sincerely held religious beliefs.Duties: Remains attentive; greets all members and guests that enter the facility Ensures that all members and guests stop at the Front Desk to check-in or are directed to the proper department. Assist with membership duties; answering questions, providing membership information, opening member accounts, providing and accepting forms such as bridging, payment information change, cancellations, etc. Process point of sale transactions. Answer the phones and page overhead as needed. Answer guest and member questions to the best of his/her ability and refer them to other staff members as necessary. Communicates regular and special facility promotions. Ensures a high level of customer service through customer service initiatives including ensuring all patrons are greeted as they come and go. Reports any customer service issues or concerns to management or cleaning staff when appropriate. Replaces supplies in bathrooms and locker rooms as needed. Folds towels and does laundry as needed. Participates in hourly cleanings. Monitor towel check in/out. Maintains professionalism when not assisting customers; avoids eating, sitting, reading, watching TV, or any other activities that are not work-related while in public areas. Performs other related duties as assigned Qualifications: Demonstrates eligibility to work for any employer in the U.S. High school diploma, GED, or suitable equivalent, or; Currently enrolled as a junior or senior working toward high school graduation One year receptionist or customer service is preferred. Current First Aid and CPR/AED certification (Must be obtained within 90 days of hire) Excellent interpersonal, presentation, and communication skills required. Self-Confident and able to comfortably interact with clients of diverse backgrounds and varying fitness levels. Demonstrated skills in verbal and written English communications for safe and effective patient care and to meet documentation standards. Able to work in a fast-paced and stressful environment while maintaining positive energy. Willingness to participate in goal-setting and educational activities for professional advancement. Able to work compassionately with patients and coworkers to exhibit patient care second to none Demonstrates enthusiasm and drive. Exudes respect and flexibility to impact the workplace in a positive manner. Detailed oriented, conscientious and committed to precision in work results. Ability to perform to a high level of accuracy Friendly, empathetic & respectful Reliable in work results, timeliness & attendance Ability to relate to and work effectively with a wonderfully diverse populace Insight is an equal opportunity employer and values workplace diversity!

title: Fitness Sales Front Desk
description: The purpose of the Sales Representative is to assist the General Manager with new membership sales by bringing new members to the studio, building a relationship, providing a positive experience, and successfully moving them through the sales process to a membership sale. The Sales Representative also assists with retaining and providing unmated customer service to current members. Boutique fitness knowledge or experience is preferred, but not required. This position is a part-time position that will start at 10 hours a week and increase from there based on performance. COMPENSATION & PERKS:This position offers a competitive base rateCommission paid on personal salesTraining OpportunitiesOpportunities for growth within the studios including additional sales and management positionsFree unlimited membership to Pure BarreEmployee Retail DiscountsDutiesExecute sales process of lead generation, follow up, and closeConduct tours of the facility while establishing a relationship and targeting individual’s goals and needsMeet and/or exceed personal and studio sales goalsEmphasize and enforce objectives of the studio as a fitness and wellness providerPresent available services to current or prospective membersBook quality appointments to achieve monthly sales quotaParticipate in special events (health fairs, grand openings, and community events) to promote the studioOperate studio gym software (Club Ready)Follow up and follow through activities with prospective clients via in-person, over the phone and emailSell retail clothing and other itemsAttend and complete all relative training programsTake pictures for social media platformsLight cleaning of the retail area, studio, and restroomsOther duties as assignedRequirementsExcellent sales, communication, and customer service skills requiredWarm welcoming and engaging personalityAbility to build strong customer relationshipsGoal-oriented with an ability to achieve sales in memberships and retailSelf-motivated and takes initiateMust have proficient computer skills and ability to learn and use the ClubReady software systemMust be have excellent communication skills via in person, phone and emailStrong organizational and multitasking skillsMust be able to work under pressure and meet tight deadlinesAuthorization to work in the United States requiredPure Barre is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Pure Barre does not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, military service, or other non-merit factor.” We are dedicated to providing a work environment free from discrimination and harassment where employees are treated with respect and dignity.

title: Fitness Manager
description: Full Time Fitness ManagerSalary $60KGreat benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, STD/LTD, 401K with matching 3%, Scholarship Opportunities, in addition you can receive discount tickets to amusement parks, hotels, care rentals etc. through Plum Benefits (Tickets at work) generous Paid Time Off, 7 paid holidays and Daily Pay through UKG Wallet. Annual Employee RecognitionIngleside at Rock Creek is the treasured home of a diverse group of people whose experiences and interests create the perfect balance for stylish retirement living. The community includes retirees from the Foreign Service and the Department of State, former educators from the highest levels of academia, writers and musicians and successful entrepreneurs, all with a common view of elegant living in retirement. We are an award-winning life plan community "Great Place to work "4 years in a row, and "SAGE" Certified.Job RequirementsBachelor's degree in Kinesiology, Physical Education, Health Services, Sports/Wellness Studies or related field, five (5) to eight (8) years of personal training, physical education, private and/or group instruction or recreation management; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Senior Fitness Specialist Certification is desired. Incumbent should be able to apply common fitness practices to carry out programs for residents in various levels of abilities (Independent Living, Assisted Living, Skilled Nursing, and Memory Care) and staff, possess high-quality verbal and written communication ability, strong interpersonal skills, and be knowledgeable of state and federal health care regulations. Must be proficient in the operation of medical equipment's such as chair lifts, pulleys, walkers, etc. Must be proficient in the use of computer applications such as Microsoft Office and related software.Job SummaryThis position oversees the fitness department, which provides customized fitness programming, group exercise and overall wellness of Ingleside residents and staff. As a member of the Life Enrichment department, this position promotes dimensions of wellness focused, but not limited to, physical and social wellness. Additionally, this position provides oversight of aquatic fitness programming, works with the pool contractor and plant operations to ensure reported repairs to the pool area are done in a timely manner, and oversees fitness areas including gym and studio spaces. Coordinates the first responder program for residents and staff including the CPR/first aide certification program.EEO StatementAs an employer committed to Equal Employment Opportunity, Ingleside recruits, hires, and promotes qualified persons in all job classifications without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ethnic origin, disability, genetic information, covered veteran status, or any other basis protected by law.Job Posted by ApplicantPro

title: Fitness Manager
description: FITNESS MANAGERAre you a dynamic leader with sales, management, and coaching experience that wants to have a large impact in the fitness industry? Are you goal-oriented? Are you operations-minded? Are you driven and motivated? Do you like working with people?If this sounds like you, we'd love to have you on our team!CompensationOn target compensation: $95,000PTOEmployee DiscountsFree Staff MembershipCompetencies2+ years of demonstrated ability to lead and develop a team2+ years of demonstrated sales and operational excellence in a fitness/gym settingDemonstrated ability to improve sales & operationsDemonstrated ability to scale membership countObjectivesScale gym from 100 members to 350 membersHire a team of excellent sales associates and coachesLead, manage, and develop a team of coaches & sales associates to excellency in their rolesEnsure compliance with franchise rules and systemsAbout Sasquatch StrengthWe offer fun, strength-based group workouts led by coaches who actually care and help coach you through the other 23 hours of your day when you’re not at the gym. At Sasquatch, we know that strength training is the gateway to long term wellness; we know that good relationships are the precursor to long and fulfilling lives and we know that EVERYONE deserves the confidence that comes from feeling good in their own skin. That’s why we’ve designed a program that gives real, regular people what they need: results that last, confidence, and peace of mind knowing their health is “taken care of”. We also know that our members’ lives don’t begin and end in the gym, so we emphasize the importance of what they do in “the other 23” - all the hours that they aren’t with us in the gym. We want everyone to live longer, better lives and we know that "better" is different for everyone. That's why we make it our mission to get to know every member personally and find out WHY they are with us, so we can work together to find a path to their individual goals…because everyone deserves to feel strong.

title: Front Desk Agent
description: Description: Job Summary As a Front Desk Sales Associate, you will be responsible for providing a superior level of customer service to Planet Fitness members, prospective members and guests while ensuring an exceptional “Judgement Free” member experience! All of our Team Members at Planet Fitness share one thing in common – a passion for our amazing brand and a desire to make our members feel welcome in our Judgement Free Zone®. Joining the PF family means being part of a company that is based on an established culture and strong set of values. It is being a part of a supportive, engaging team that cares about bettering the health and wellbeing of the community in an environment where everyone feels like they belong. It is having fun at work while creating member experiences that consistently exceed their expectations. It means being part of a brand that you can be proud of! Essential Duties and Responsibilities Greet members/guests as they enter and exit the club; assisting them with any questions or concerns as they check in. Help to promote our Judgement Free Zone® by connecting with members on the club floor, offering assistance and showing support in their fitness journeys while upholding club policies. Resolve member concerns and escalate to a Manager as needed. Answer phones in a friendly manner and assist callers with their inquiries. Perform membership related functions such as sign-ups, contact/billing information updates, cancellations, collecting unpaid balances and transferring memberships. Perform prospective member calls and tours; assessing their membership needs. Execute retail transactions with accuracy and drive sales goals. Resolve member concerns and escalate to a Manager as needed. Regular, consistent cleaning and sanitizing of all exercise equipment and Black Card spa amenities. This includes communal spaces as well as your assigned area. Ensuring restrooms are clean and sanitized, stocked and clutter free by following the routine cleaning schedule. Frequently perform a comprehensive walk of all club areas; quickly fix any safety/policy issues and address cleanliness concerns. Promptly address maintenance and facility concerns such as broken and/or missing equipment (i.e., Dispensers, leaky faucets, fixtures etc.) This role is subject to successful completion of a background check, post offer acceptance. All background screens will be conducted in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws Requirements: Qualifications/Requirements 6-12 months of experience in a customer service environment is preferred Must be 18 years of age or older Willing to become CPR/AED Certified (Training provided by Planet Fitness) Basic computer proficiency Physical Demands Continual standing and moving throughout the club to accomplish tasks during shift. Continual communicating in person or on the phone to exchange information during shift. Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds. Will encounter toxic chemicals during shift. Frequent cleaning and sanitizing of equipment and facilities. Moving self in different positions, including bending and twisting, to accomplish tasks. More reasons to join Planet Fitness! Medical benefits Free Black Card Membership 401(K) Savings Plan Employee perks and discounts Engaging team-building competitions and social events Health and Safety Requirements Every team member is responsible for contributing to a safe and healthy workplace. Team members are expected to be active participants in health and safety by following all applicable policies and protocols, reporting unsafe conditions or at-risk behaviors to leadership, and conducting work in a safe manner.

title: Physical Therapist
description: Job Title: Physical Therapist Department: Physical Therapy Accountability: This position reports to the Clinic Manager Responsibilities: Identifies patient’s needs by performing an initial exam, evaluate medical record and doctor’s referral and determine a diagnosis Communicates effectively with doctors, nurses, and case managers Consults with patients and develop a treatment plan Documents patient care services by charting in patient and department records Performs therapeutic procedures by administering manual exercises; instructing, encouraging, and assisting patients in performing physical activities, such as non-manual exercises, ambulatory functional activities, and daily-living activities; and in using supportive devices, such as crutches, canes, and prostheses Instructs and counsels patients by describing therapeutic regimens; giving normal growth and development information; promoting wellness and health maintenance. Provides continuity of care by developing and implementing patient management plans. Maintains safe and clean working environment by complying with procedures, rules, and regulations; adhering to infection-control policies and protocols. Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in Physical Therapy Physical Therapist License Entry level position Bilingual (English and Spanish) a plus Ability and willingness to work flexible hours Must be able to apply common sense reasoning to carry out instructions Ability to understand written and verbal instructions in English Ability to work in a team environment and communicate effectively Must possess a strong attention to detail Must be able to tolerate long periods of standing, squatting, kneeling, and bending Company Details: Fortaleza has been dedicated to excellence in the field of physical therapy since 1994. We offer a wide range of programs and specialized services to help our patients restore and maintain their physical strength, performance skills, and levels of function. Our highly respected clinical staff has a strong reputation for clinical quality, effective outcomes, and exceptional customer service. Together, we are completely committed to improving our patients' health, their well-being, and most of all, their quality of life. The Fortaleza staff leads with a forward-thinking Patients First philosophy that is applied to all aspects of our operation. For our patients, this means that Fortaleza will work every day to meet every one of their rehabilitation needs. Our patients can always expect: individualized care, advanced treatment techniques, and clinical excellence. Fortaleza - Website: www.lafortalezarehab.com Fortaleza offers Physical Therapy, Occupational Therapy, and a Fitness Center Three locations in Philadelphia: Hunting Park, Cedar, and Central Company offers Health, Dental, Vision and IRA Plan with matching contributions STD, LTD, LIFE, and AD&D offered to all employees Generous Paid Time Off and Holiday benefits Competitive pay commensurate with education, skills, and experience Prepared by: Human Resources Approved by: Vice President of Clinical OperationsRelated keywords: physical therapist, physical therapy Job Types: Full-time, Part-time Pay: $35.00 - $50.00 per hour Medical specialties: Physical & Rehabilitation Medicine Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Experience: Physical Therapy: 1 year (Preferred) Language: Spanish (Preferred) License/Certification: Physical Therapy License (Preferred) CPR Certification (Preferred) Work Location: Multiple locations Typical start time: 8AM Typical end time: 5PM Workplace Setting: Private Practice Company's website: https://www.lafortalezarehab.com Benefit Conditions: Only full-time employees eligible Work Remotely: No COVID-19 Precaution(s): Temperature screenings Social distancing guidelines in place Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place Work Location: Multiple locations

title: Fitness Instructor
description: Job Title: Fitness Instructor/Personal Trainer Location: 4710 South State Rd, Ann Arbor MI, 48108 Compensation: $16,120 - $28,080 annually (full-time) Sign on bonus = $500 Merit increases are based on performance and education. AFS covers the cost of your ACSM Exercise Physiologist certification. Why Work at Applied Fitness Solutions At AFS we strongly believe our employees are our most important stakeholder. We view leadership’s primary responsibility as taking great care of our team, so the team can take even better care of our members. With that in mind, you should work at AFS because you’re looking for a fitness organization that can provide you a stable schedule, a stable income, health insurance benefits, educational opportunities and career growth. You should work for AFS because you’re looking to get out of the rat race of having to be constantly “selling yourself” to ensure you have consistent hours and income. Indeed, you should work at AFS because you want a consistent, stable, and fulfilling career in fitness. Benefits to Working at Applied Fitness Solutions Consistent & Stable Weekly Work Schedule Consistent & Stable Paycheck Consistent Wage Increase based on Education Attainment & Performance Health Insurance Benefits (full-time) Educational Stipend for American College of Sports Medicine Certification Robust internal employee education curriculum to improve your knowledge, skills, and abilities Collaborative culture of teamwork Who Applied Fitness Solutions Is – At Its Core We're a dedicated group of health & fitness professionals driven by our mission to make the world a healthier, happier place. For the past 15 years, our focus on seeing and serving the whole person has endeared us to our community and allowed us to embody the mantra "More Than Fitness." We're looking for like-hearted individuals who find deep meaning in helping others move their bodies; who care just as much about connection as they do about conditioning. If you've seen firsthand how transformative change in lifestyle can be and you're looking for a growth inducing outlet to share that experience, apply! Hours & Responsibilities This position will require a combination of weekend shifts, early mornings, and evening shifts. Flexibility to work various shifts is preferred. Hour Requirement: Part-Time: > 15 hours/week You will be responsible for providing a top-notch customer experience in every exercise setting and coaching experience, based on evidence-based exercise science principles. Primary duties/responsibility include: Progressing quickly through AFS’ internal employee education curriculum. Achieving appropriate professional certifications through the American College of Sports Medicine. Maintain appropriate continuing professional education. Stewarding members through a safe & meaningful exercise experience, when instructing clients in both group, and personal training sessions. Onboarding new clients through an evidence-based fitness evaluation and health coaching experience. Performance Expectations: Growth seeking individuals open to giving and receiving constructive feedback related to our values. Build and maintain strong member relationships. Lead and coach in a highly interactive group training environment. Demonstrate exercises and provide appropriate and individualized modifications when needed. Record detailed notes about clients’ medical and orthopedic issues. Maintain educational & performance requirements each quarter. Relevant Skills & Education: Bachelor’s degree (or currently enrolled) in Exercise Science or related field (preferred) ACSM, ACE or NSCA Certified Personal Trainer (preferred) Demonstrated history of punctuality and attendance (required) Customer service experience (required) Excellent written and verbal communication skills (required) Desired Personal Characteristics Genuinely enjoys serving others & exceeding client expectations Ability to learn quickly, improvise, and think on the fly Growth-seeker who is hungry for development Bring themselves wholeheartedly to work everyday Comfortable giving and receiving frequent feedback Very detail-oriented Juggles multiple tasks and responsibilities with ease Equal Employment Opportunity Applied Fitness Solutions is an equal employment opportunity employer and does not discriminate against employees or job applicants on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, age, national origin, mental or physical disability, veteran or family status, marital status, citizenship, height, weight, or any other status or condition protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. This policy extends to all aspects of the employment relationship, including, but not limited to, recruiting, interviewing, hiring, job assignments, training, compensation, benefits, promotion, demotion, transfer, discipline, use of facilities, participation in Applied Fitness Solutions-sponsored activities, termination, and all other terms, conditions, and privileges of employment. Job Type: Part-time Pay: $16,120.00 - $28,080.00 per year Benefits: Flexible schedule Schedule: Monday to Friday Weekend availability Supplemental pay types: Commission pay Signing bonus Ability to commute/relocate: Ann Arbor, MI 48108: Reliably commute or willing to relocate with an employer-provided relocation package (Required) Work Location: In person

title: Personal Trainer
description: Looking for CERTIFIED, career minded, hard working, experienced Personal Trainers. You will be part of our family and work for us- you will not be an independent trainer. title: Gym Director - Movement Golden
description: Job DetailsDescriptionAt Movement, our core values of partnership, inclusion, passion, innovation, and integrity are at the heart of everything we do. We're not just a climbing gym - we're a community that's dedicated to transforming lives through climbing, yoga, and fitness and sharing that vision with as many people as we can. As the country’s largest network of climbing gyms, with facilities in California, Colorado, Illinois, Maryland, Oregon, Texas, and D.C., we're building an extraordinary team that's committed to growing our business, our value to our members, our future customers, and our industry.By expanding our community, we can create rewarding career paths for our team members, continually improve the customer experience, build a sustainable business for the long term, and give back to the communities we are all a part of. We’re looking for passionate, resilient, and business-minded enthusiasts who share our values and want to join us in not only leading the climbing industry but defining it!Job SummaryThe gym leadership team is comprised of the Gym Director and Assistant Gym Director. As a team, they are responsible for ensuring that the gym functions smoothly, all staff are supported and upholding our Core Values and that we are providing an excellent customer experience.The Gym Director will report to the Sr. Director. They will work with this person to establish goals for the gym and use them as a resource for the growth of their respective gym.The ideal candidate will have a balance of great customer service and leadership skills, as well as excellent administrative abilities. Proven success in developing and managing a high performing team in a fast-paced environment and the ability to see the big picture as well as the everyday details are essential to being a successful gym director. We’re looking for someone who can be part of a highly collaborative team, but also think and execute independently.Job ResponsibilitiesProvides leadership and direction to all climbing center staff in alignment with our mission, vision and values.Recruits, hires, develops, and mentors service-oriented, collaborative, passionate team made up of gym leaders, and operational staff including yoga and fitness staff.Oversees facility operations including maintenance, cleanliness, routes, retail, programming, and community events.Initiates and implements processes, protocols, and procedures to ensure the gym runs in an effective and service-oriented manner while meeting financial goals.Ensures the team is supported and through them, the gym runs smoothly: all administrative needs are met, all staff are well-trained, and our members and guests’ experiences are awesome.Works proactively to build relationships in the community to drive membership growth and retention.Leads by example and participates in front of house gym operations as part of a rotating management schedule.Job Requirements Experience running a fast-paced, high volume business , with a large, multi-departmental team. Knowledge of climbing center operations including retail, routes and programming.Demonstrated relationships within the climbing community and the ability to leverage those relationships to build a strong community in the gym.Excellent communication skills and customer service abilities.Embodies the mission, vision and values and able to foster this sense of culture in all staff.Ability to build a strong staff community, hold accountability to expectations, and develop future leaders.Ability to work independently and juggle competing priorities.Ability to solve problems and handle difficult situations with sound judgment.Proficient in organizational tools such as web-based applications, MS Office and POS tools.Passionate individual who is eager to integrate and build the local climbing community. Schedule & PresenceAbility to provide consistent presence in gym by working from gym daily.Largely works a weekday schedule, including regular presence during weeknight peak hours, with a rotation of weekend presence. Ability to flex schedule to attend events or gym needs.Uses their gym regularly for climbing, working out and yoga, including during peak hours such as weeknights and weekends.Additional InformationFull-time, salary positionThe starting annual salary for this position ranges from $50k to $85k. Actual pay rate will vary based on a candidate's location, qualifications, skills and experience.Paid time offHealth benefits and retirement plan availableFree gym membershipMovement is an Equal Opportunity Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status or marital status. Applications are now open for this position.

title: Fitness Manager
description: FITNESS MANAGERAre you a dynamic leader with sales, management, and coaching experience that wants to have a large impact in the fitness industry? Are you goal-oriented? Are you operations-minded? Are you driven and motivated? Do you like working with people?If this sounds like you, we'd love to have you on our team!CompensationOn target compensation: $95,000PTOEmployee DiscountsFree Staff MembershipCompetencies2+ years of demonstrated ability to lead and develop a team2+ years of demonstrated sales and operational excellence in a fitness/gym settingDemonstrated ability to improve sales & operationsDemonstrated ability to scale membership countObjectivesScale gym from 100 members to 350 membersHire a team of excellent sales associates and coachesLead, manage, and develop a team of coaches & sales associates to excellency in their rolesEnsure compliance with franchise rules and systemsAbout Sasquatch StrengthWe offer fun, strength-based group workouts led by coaches who actually care and help coach you through the other 23 hours of your day when you’re not at the gym. At Sasquatch, we know that strength training is the gateway to long term wellness; we know that good relationships are the precursor to long and fulfilling lives and we know that EVERYONE deserves the confidence that comes from feeling good in their own skin. That’s why we’ve designed a program that gives real, regular people what they need: results that last, confidence, and peace of mind knowing their health is “taken care of”. We also know that our members’ lives don’t begin and end in the gym, so we emphasize the importance of what they do in “the other 23” - all the hours that they aren’t with us in the gym. We want everyone to live longer, better lives and we know that "better" is different for everyone. That's why we make it our mission to get to know every member personally and find out WHY they are with us, so we can work together to find a path to their individual goals…because everyone deserves to feel strong.

title: Assistant Gym Director
description: Life’s too short to not work someplace awesome! If you have tons of energy, love kids and are looking for a way to give back to your community, you may be the person we are looking for!The Assistant Gym Director role is a (full-time/part-time) career level position, responsible for assisting the Gym Director with the overall performance of a The Little Gym location. Typically, the Assistant Gym Director reports directly to the Gym Director or the owners of a specific The Little Gym location.Essential Job FunctionsTeach GREAT classes based on our proven curriculum and teaching methodAssist the Gym Director in leading a team in providing outstanding customer service and membership experience second to noneManage day-to-day operations alongside the Gym DirectorHire, manage and oversee training of staff alongside the Gym DirectorMaintain facility and equipmentSell The Little Gym program to new customersOther operational tasks as assigned by Gym DirectorQualificationsA background in child development, physical education and/or gymnastics is a plusCustomer service experienceManagement experienceExcellent time management skillsGreat attitude and strong work ethicLove to have fun and not only smiles easily but finds joy in making others smileWhy is The Little Gym a great place to work?Strong sense of fulfillmentKeep fit as you workFun, high energy work environmentCompetitive compensationComprehensive ongoing career trainingExcellent opportunity for career growth and advancementWith more than 300 locations across the globe, The Little Gym is the world’s premier enrichment and physical development center for kids 4 months through 12 years. For over four decades, The Little Gym has helped millions of kids experience the thrill of achievement, develop new skills, and find new confidence through a variety of gymnastics-based programs. Parent/Child, Pre-K and Grade School classes are all taught in a clean, fun, safe and nurturing environment, which encourages children to develop at their own pace.As a part of The Little Gym team, you will be part of a family dedicated to the growth and development of children all over the globe. If this sounds like the position you’ve been looking for, please forward your contact information and resume to us for immediate consideration.

title: Gym & Lake Activities Attendant - Summer Seas
description: “We Want Changemakers!”Is that you? At Moonlight Basin our Mantra is Motivation, Opportunity, Organization, Leadership, Integrity, and Teamwork. We offer our “changemakers” an inclusive, rewarding, fun, work environment, with endless opportunity to provide the highest levels of service and experience positive teamwork.Whether it’s winter or summer, Moonlight Basin is something you won’t soon forget! The mountain scenery, direct access to the 28,000 acers of pristine wilderness, hiking, fishing, rafting, golf and so much more all add up to the perfect place to work and the perfect place to enjoy Montana.GYM & LAKE ACTIVITIES ATTENDANT – SUMMER SEASON This position is a part of the Moonlight Basin Outfitters team that requires guest service experience while facilitating activities and experiences both indoors and out. Attendants will facilitate outdoor activities at a small mountain lake location including canoes, kayaks, and stand-up paddleboards as well as facilitate indoor activities and games in an indoor basketball gymnasium and climbing wall facility. Attendants should be able to take ownership and maintain their workspaces while providing safe and fun experiences for all! WHAT YOU WILL DO:Meet and greet members, assist with check-in and equipment usage, waiver completion, and field questions regarding activities in both the gymnasium and beach space. Provide safe, fun, and professional tips while outfitting members in gymnasium, climbing wall, and beachfront amenities within Moonlight Basin guidelines. Build relationships with members and guests to verify appropriate use of spaces. Oversee use and cleanliness of beach, yurt, and gymnasium spaces. Complete daily opening and closing tasks including, but not limited to trash and recycling disposal, restocking, and maintaining facilities, and towel restock.Communicate with supervisory staff regarding inventory, safety concerns, and areas of improvement. Help lead and organize special daily/weekly events using the gymnasium and lake areas. Maintains a personable and professional attitude while interacting with all members, coworkers, and supervisory staff.Participate in all required trainings, safety, and professional development opportunities. Assist in special events as needed.  KEYS TO SUCCESS:Experience with customer service as it pertains to indoor sports, lifeguarding, and family events a plus. High school diploma or equivalentResourcefulness, good judgement, and self-confidence. A professional, positive, and personable attitude while interacting comfortably with an affluent group of members and the positions supervisory staff. Effective and timely communication skills, written and oral, with a variety of ages and skill levels. Current CPR/First Aid certification or ability to obtain before start date.BENEFITS OF EMPLOYMENT:End-of-season bonusEmployee Appreciation BonusEnd-of-season employee celebrationComplimentary meal per shift End-of-season discounts on our retail store items.Tuition reimbursementMatching 401(k)PI229480721

title: Yoga Instructor
description: Description:Bridges Rock Gym is looking for an enthusiastic, part-time Yoga Instructor who’s stoked on helping our customers achieve their personal fitness goals by teaching group classes indoors and outdoors. Ideal candidates will have experience leading fitness classes with a diverse clientele, as well as drive to improve their craft. We currently offer around 20 Yoga + Fitness classes per week, and we offer the opportunity for the right candidates to work in different disciplines. Responsibilities:Develop an intelligent, creative, and accessible HIIT, Sculpt, Strength + Conditioning, Circuits, Boxing, or other Fitness class curriculum for members and guestsAbide by our Yoga + Fitness Program Policy AgreementAssist Program Manager in monthly reporting on class progress and development, as neededAssist Program Manager in organized, regular communication with members and guests on program and schedule updates, as neededAssist Program Manager in promoting your class/es to our members and guestsMaintain a high level of knowledge and proficiency in your discipline, as well as staying up-to-date on trends in specific fitness industry Qualifications: Current Certifications for intended discipline, i.e. Yoga Alliance Certified Yoga Teacher Training Certification, NASM Personal Training Certification, TRX Certification, Pilates Certification etc.2+ years experience actively instructing specific discipline Must maintain General Liability Insurance, with Interior Elevation, LLC, dba Bridges Rock Gym listed as additional insuredCurrent CPR and First Aid certificationsAbility to perform exercises and movements as demonstrations for members and guests, as neededPassion for guiding specific discipline, as well as helping members and guests meet or exceed their fitness goals Compensation: Competitive, commensurate with experience Privileges:Gym Membership, guest passes, pro deals, industry perks

title: Children's Gymnastics Instructor
company_name: The Little Gym of Stevens Creek
description: The Little Gym of Stevens Creek is an interactive kids center that offers multiple programs. We teach children of all ages, using fitness in a non-competitive environment as a springboard to boost skills and confidence! If you're looking for a place to make a positive impact on children that will last a lifetime, then this is the place for you! Your biggest responsibility will be to make learning "Serious Fun" which is guaranteed to put a smile on everyone's face. We'll train the right "big kid" everything there is to know. So, if sitting at desk all day isn't your scene and you'd prefer to wear shorts or yoga pants and a shirt all day, then contact us today!We are actively looking for applicants available in the afternoon. With shifts ranging from 3:00 to 9:00 pm on weekdays and 11:30 to 3:30/7:30 pm on weekends. Individuals with Tuesday/Thursday availability are highly considered.What we expect from you:Teach amazing fitness classes and other programs based on our proven curriculum and teaching method (don't worry, we'll teach you how!)Provide an outstanding customer service experience. It's important that we work to keep our facility area cleaned and disinfected at all times.Must be athletic (gymnastics, dance or cheer experience is a plus but don't worry, we can train the right candidate!)Be able to Tumble is a major plus, being willing to learn is also great!Be able to lift a minimum of 50 lbs.Have Weekend availability; Availability on one weekend day is required. Previous Coaching experience is highly recommended.Must LOVE kids!

title: Front Desk Agent
description: Description: Job Summary As a Front Desk Sales Associate, you will be responsible for providing a superior level of customer service to Planet Fitness members, prospective members and guests while ensuring an exceptional “Judgement Free” member experience! All of our Team Members at Planet Fitness share one thing in common – a passion for our amazing brand and a desire to make our members feel welcome in our Judgement Free Zone®. Joining the PF family means being part of a company that is based on an established culture and strong set of values. It is being a part of a supportive, engaging team that cares about bettering the health and wellbeing of the community in an environment where everyone feels like they belong. It is having fun at work while creating member experiences that consistently exceed their expectations. It means being part of a brand that you can be proud of! Essential Duties and Responsibilities Greet members/guests as they enter and exit the club; assisting them with any questions or concerns as they check in. Help to promote our Judgement Free Zone® by connecting with members on the club floor, offering assistance and showing support in their fitness journeys while upholding club policies. Resolve member concerns and escalate to a Manager as needed. Answer phones in a friendly manner and assist callers with their inquiries. Perform membership related functions such as sign-ups, contact/billing information updates, cancellations, collecting unpaid balances and transferring memberships. Perform prospective member calls and tours; assessing their membership needs. Execute retail transactions with accuracy and drive sales goals. Resolve member concerns and escalate to a Manager as needed. Regular, consistent cleaning and sanitizing of all exercise equipment and Black Card spa amenities. This includes communal spaces as well as your assigned area. Ensuring restrooms are clean and sanitized, stocked and clutter free by following the routine cleaning schedule. Frequently perform a comprehensive walk of all club areas; quickly fix any safety/policy issues and address cleanliness concerns. Promptly address maintenance and facility concerns such as broken and/or missing equipment (i.e., Dispensers, leaky faucets, fixtures etc.) This role is subject to successful completion of a background check, post offer acceptance. All background screens will be conducted in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws Requirements: Qualifications/Requirements 6-12 months of experience in a customer service environment is preferred Must be 18 years of age or older Willing to become CPR/AED Certified (Training provided by Planet Fitness) Basic computer proficiency Physical Demands Continual standing and moving throughout the club to accomplish tasks during shift. Continual communicating in person or on the phone to exchange information during shift. Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds. Will encounter toxic chemicals during shift. Frequent cleaning and sanitizing of equipment and facilities. Moving self in different positions, including bending and twisting, to accomplish tasks. More reasons to join Planet Fitness! Medical benefits Free Black Card Membership 401(K) Savings Plan Employee perks and discounts Engaging team-building competitions and social events Health and Safety Requirements Every team member is responsible for contributing to a safe and healthy workplace. Team members are expected to be active participants in health and safety by following all applicable policies and protocols, reporting unsafe conditions or at-risk behaviors to leadership, and conducting work in a safe manner.

title: Personal Trainer
description: **Personal Trainer, Unicorn Wrangler & Chief Muscle Whisperer with a Dash of Sales Magic** Commission Estimated $1000-$4500 per month (uncapped) Are you a Personal Trainer with the sales prowess of a used car salesman, the charm of a smooth-talking auctioneer, and the biceps to back it all up? Do you dream about sculpting not just bodies, but bank accounts? Well, we've got the job for you! **Job Title:** Senior Fitness Sales Consultant **Location:** Oak Park & Downtown Oak Park Orangetheory Fitness: Where Abs Are Made and Quotas Are Crushed **About Us:** At Orangetheory, we don't just transform bodies – we turn flab into fab and wallets into wonderlands. Our high-ticket program combines sculpting sweat sessions, accountability nagging (oops, we mean coaching), and custom nutrition that make kale taste like candy. We're on a mission to make six-packs more common than selfies, and we need your sales mojo to get there! **What You'll Do:** - Flex your sales muscles by consulting with potential clients that they absolutely need a workout experience that's practically life-changing. Just imagine the confidence boost of deadlifting your financial worries away! - Juggle more prospects than a clown at a balloon convention, managing a pipeline that's bigger than a bodybuilder's protein shake. - Set quotas on fire and watch them turn into flaming sales achievements. Cold calls? More like gold calls! - Collaborate with our clients and members to hold them accountable to attending 3-4 classes per week and making sure they are logging their meals **Requirements:** - Sales swagger that can rival a peacock's strut. Bonus points if you can close a deal while holding a dumbbell in one hand and a protein shake in the other. - Experience herding cats or managing something equally challenging – like a group of gym-goers during peak hours. - A penchant for acronyms: NASM, ACE, and even LOL. (We like trainers who can LOL their way through a tough workout!) - The ability to calculate commissions so high, you'll need a calculator with extra digits. - A commitment to making people fit, fabulous, and financially invested in their own well-being. This job does not involve training but that is an option. If chosen, part of the job responsibility is to work with clients virtually so remote work may be necessary **Perks:** - Commission? Sky's the limit! (Seriously, we don't even have a limit – it's more like a commission black hole.) - Unlimited classes, because if you're going to sell like a beast, you've got to workout like one too. - Access to the Orangetheory secret stash of motivational cat posters – because sometimes even personal trainers need a pep talk. If you're ready to lift not just weights, but the spirits of potential clients, and if you're not afraid to close deals faster than a gym rat on a treadmill, then dust off your sales cape and apply now! Remember, at Orangetheory, we're not just changing bodies – we're sculpting sales careers. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $16.00 - $21.00 per hour Benefits: Dental insurance Employee discount Flexible schedule Health insurance Paid time off Referral program Relocation assistance Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Weekends as needed Supplemental pay types: Bonus opportunities Commission pay Ability to commute/relocate: Frankfort, IL 60423: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required) Application Question(s): Do you have experience selling fitness or nutrition programs? License/Certification: Certified Personal Trainer (Required) Shift availability: Day Shift (Required) Work Location: In person

title: Childcare Provider
description: POSITION DESCRIPTION POSITION NAME: Child Care Attendant (CCA) DEPARTMENT: Kid Care REPORTS TO: Child Care Team Lead FLSA STATUS: Non-Exempt, Hourly COMPENSATION: Pay Rate is $10.00 per hour. JOIN OUR TEAM At VASA Fitness, we want to create an uplifting experience for everyone by offering inclusive, accessible, and on-trend fitness. The foundation of our brand is rooted in a culture centered on unity, passion, love, integrity, fun, and trust. Because our culture is alive-embodied by members and team members alike-VASA is a place where lives are changed because of authentic connections made within our supportive community. We offer a competitive, all-encompassing benefits package which includes healthcare benefits for employees who work 20+ hours per week. All employees receive two complimentary gym memberships-one for themselves and another to give away-plus 401k options. 30+ hours per week employees:Paid Time Off (hourly),Health, Dental, Vision Benefits and Paid Parental Leave (in addition to above) 40 hours per week employees:Flexible Vacation Plan (salary) & Paid Holidays (in addition to above) Come join VASA Fitness and join a passionate, fun, and united team! PURPOSE Child Care Attendants are responsible for the care and well-being of the children of our mini members and guests during their stay with VASA Fitness. The Attendants are responsible for maintaining the safety, cleanliness, and general upkeep of the childcare area. Attendants must adhere to internal policy and procedures to ensure the efficient and safe operation of our KidCare facilities. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS Upholding KidCare Standards: Ensure all guests, members, and mini members feel welcome by greeting them by name and saying a friendly goodbye when they leave. The CCA will engage with all mini members and members in a positive manner, follow company policies, and ensure mini members are participating in fun and entertaining activities. Safety of our Mini Members: Follow the checking in and out procedure to ensure the safety of our mini members. Maintain cleanliness and safety of the KidCare to establish the overall safety of the children entrusted in our care. Interact with each mini member and monitor all children during their stay. Requirements: COMPETEN CIES The competencies for successful performance in this role include, but are not limited to, the following: Passionate for Fitness Passion for Children Member Experience Champion Attention to Detail Get it Done Attitude! Positive Energy PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS The qualifications for this position include, but are not limited to, the following: Experience in childcare First Aid and CPR certified required within first 60 days of employment Customer Service experience Bilingual preferred but not required This position description intends to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. It is not intended to include all duties and responsibilities. The order in which duties and responsibilities are listed is not significant. VASA Fitness is an Equal Opportunity Employer Compensation: $10.00 per hour

title: Personal Trainer
description: Who We ARE: When you work at the Best. Gym. Ever, you join the Best. Team. Ever. You'll walk into our clean and spacious gyms with a smile on your face and a pep in your step because you know you are about to change lives! High-five your team and get ready to move quickly! Combine your passion for fitness and love of people into your career at The Edge Fitness Clubs! What We LOVE: People. Fitness. Teamwork. Fun. Changing Lives. What We Offer YOU: We will give you a FREE Gym membership for you and a friend! Get your workout in during lunch or after shift! We "insure" you and your family stay healthy with our tiered Health Benefits: Medical, Dental & Vision. We work hard to play hard... take your vacation! PTO & Paid Holidays. Vacation days improve overall wellbeing! We make sure you plan for your future. Enroll in our 401k. We want you to save money! There are discounts on personal training, apparel, shake bar & Edge Kids! We want you to grow! Team builders, Leadership and Development training, all opportunities to advance! We want you to advance your education! Reimbursed training certifications! We protect you with our company paid Life insurance ($25k), and Long-Term Disability (LTD) and Employee Assistance Program (EAP) We will give you an awesome culture and fun work environment! Look forward to coming to work each day! What You'll Do: Establish a personal training client base Deliver safe, professional, exciting and comprehensive personal training programs to ensure clients are satisfied with their workout program and remain motivated to attain their personal fitness goals Maintain knowledge and promote Edge Fitness programs, services, and products What You'll Need: Ability to build relationship with members Excellent customer service and promotional skills; energetic, enthusiastic, and motivational Extensive knowledge of fitness, cardiovascular training, nutrition, and program design Demonstrate exercises and adjust machine weights, free weights, and cardiovascular equipment Excellent time management and organizational skills Ability to operate a computer and Microsoft Office software (Word and Excel) Requirements: Education & Experience: High school diploma or GED Four year degree in exercise science, sports medicine, or other related field preferred One year personal training experience preferred Program design experience preferred Certified Personal Trainer (minimum of one certification) CPR/AED certification Obtain one of the core four certifications within 6 months of hire: NASM, ACE, ISSA or NSCA Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. This position requires the ability to perform an aerobic activity for the duration of a class. Bending and moving is done frequently. Employee is regularly required to talk and hear. Physical activity will include standing, walking, reaching with hands and arms, climbing or balancing, sitting and stooping, kneeling, crouching, or crawling. Lifting requirements are 50 pounds and occasionally up to 100 pounds. The vision requirements are close, distant, depth, and ability to adjust focus. Work Environment: This job operates in a health club environment. This position routinely deals with club employees, members and vendors. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers and phones. This is a high paced environment. Travel: There is no travel required for this position. Position type and expected hours of work: This is a non-exempt full-time position with varied hours based on business needs. This position requires night and weekend hours. Supervisory Responsibility: This position has no supervisory responsibilities. Not all heroes wear capes, we wear sneakers and workout clothes! There is a reason our members call us the best gym ever... it's because we have the best staff ever... come join our team! It's okay... you can invite your friends to come work with you too! Edge Fitness, LLC is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. The above statements are intended to describe the general activities, duties and responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Please note these statements are not an exhaustive list of all activities, duties and responsibilities. Duties, Responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

title: Front Desk Agent
description: Description: As a Front Desk Sales Associate, you will be responsible for providing a superior level of customer service to Planet Fitness members, prospective members and guests while ensuring an exceptional “Judgement Free” member experience! All of our Team Members at Planet Fitness share one thing in common – a passion for our amazing brand and a desire to make our members feel welcome in our Judgement Free Zone®. Joining the PF family means being part of a company that is based on an established culture and strong set of values. It is being a part of a supportive, engaging team that cares about bettering the health and wellbeing of the community in an environment where everyone feels like they belong. It is having fun at work while creating member experiences that consistently exceed their expectations. It means being part of a brand that you can be proud of! Essential Duties and Responsibilities for Overnight Front Desk Greet members/guests as they enter and exit the club; assisting them with any questions or concerns as they check in. Help to promote our Judgement Free Zone® by connecting with members on the club floor, offering assistance and showing support in their fitness journeys while upholding club policies. Resolve member concerns and escalate to a Manager as needed. Answer phones in a friendly manner and assist callers with their inquiries. Perform membership related functions such as sign-ups, contact/billing information updates, cancellations, collecting unpaid balances and transferring memberships. Perform prospective member calls and tours; assessing their membership needs. Execute retail transactions with accuracy and drive sales goals. Resolve member concerns and escalate to a Manager as needed. Regular, consistent cleaning and sanitizing of all exercise equipment and Black Card spa amenities. This includes communal spaces as well as your assigned area. Ensuring restrooms are clean and sanitized, stocked and clutter free by following the routine cleaning schedule. Frequently perform a comprehensive walk of all club areas; quickly fix any safety/policy issues and address cleanliness concerns. Promptly address maintenance and facility concerns such as broken and/or missing equipment (i.e., Dispensers, leaky faucets, fixtures etc.) This is a overnight position Monday- Thursday This role is subject to successful completion of a background check, post offer acceptance. All background screens will be conducted in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws Requirements: Qualifications/Requirements 6-12 months of experience in a customer service environment is preferred Must be 18 years of age or older Willing to become CPR/AED Certified (Training provided by Planet Fitness) Basic computer proficiency Physical Demands Continual standing and moving throughout the club to accomplish tasks during shift. Continual communicating in person or on the phone to exchange information during shift. Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds. Will encounter toxic chemicals during shift. Frequent cleaning and sanitizing of equipment and facilities. Moving self in different positions, including bending and twisting, to accomplish tasks. More reasons to join Planet Fitness! Medical benefits Free Black Card Membership 401(K) Savings Plan Employee perks and discounts Engaging team-building competitions and social events Health and Safety Requirements Every team member is responsible for contributing to a safe and healthy workplace. Team members are expected to be active participants in health and safety by following all applicable policies and protocols, reporting unsafe conditions or at-risk behaviors to leadership, and conducting work in a safe manner.

title: Gym Director - Movement Golden
description: Job DetailsDescriptionAt Movement, our core values of partnership, inclusion, passion, innovation, and integrity are at the heart of everything we do. We're not just a climbing gym - we're a community that's dedicated to transforming lives through climbing, yoga, and fitness and sharing that vision with as many people as we can. As the country’s largest network of climbing gyms, with facilities in California, Colorado, Illinois, Maryland, Oregon, Texas, and D.C., we're building an extraordinary team that's committed to growing our business, our value to our members, our future customers, and our industry.By expanding our community, we can create rewarding career paths for our team members, continually improve the customer experience, build a sustainable business for the long term, and give back to the communities we are all a part of. We’re looking for passionate, resilient, and business-minded enthusiasts who share our values and want to join us in not only leading the climbing industry but defining it!Job SummaryThe gym leadership team is comprised of the Gym Director and Assistant Gym Director. As a team, they are responsible for ensuring that the gym functions smoothly, all staff are supported and upholding our Core Values and that we are providing an excellent customer experience.The Gym Director will report to the Sr. Director. They will work with this person to establish goals for the gym and use them as a resource for the growth of their respective gym.The ideal candidate will have a balance of great customer service and leadership skills, as well as excellent administrative abilities. Proven success in developing and managing a high performing team in a fast-paced environment and the ability to see the big picture as well as the everyday details are essential to being a successful gym director. We’re looking for someone who can be part of a highly collaborative team, but also think and execute independently.Job ResponsibilitiesProvides leadership and direction to all climbing center staff in alignment with our mission, vision and values.Recruits, hires, develops, and mentors service-oriented, collaborative, passionate team made up of gym leaders, and operational staff including yoga and fitness staff.Oversees facility operations including maintenance, cleanliness, routes, retail, programming, and community events.Initiates and implements processes, protocols, and procedures to ensure the gym runs in an effective and service-oriented manner while meeting financial goals.Ensures the team is supported and through them, the gym runs smoothly: all administrative needs are met, all staff are well-trained, and our members and guests’ experiences are awesome.Works proactively to build relationships in the community to drive membership growth and retention.Leads by example and participates in front of house gym operations as part of a rotating management schedule.Job Requirements Experience running a fast-paced, high volume business , with a large, multi-departmental team. Knowledge of climbing center operations including retail, routes and programming.Demonstrated relationships within the climbing community and the ability to leverage those relationships to build a strong community in the gym.Excellent communication skills and customer service abilities.Embodies the mission, vision and values and able to foster this sense of culture in all staff.Ability to build a strong staff community, hold accountability to expectations, and develop future leaders.Ability to work independently and juggle competing priorities.Ability to solve problems and handle difficult situations with sound judgment.Proficient in organizational tools such as web-based applications, MS Office and POS tools.Passionate individual who is eager to integrate and build the local climbing community. Schedule & PresenceAbility to provide consistent presence in gym by working from gym daily.Largely works a weekday schedule, including regular presence during weeknight peak hours, with a rotation of weekend presence. Ability to flex schedule to attend events or gym needs.Uses their gym regularly for climbing, working out and yoga, including during peak hours such as weeknights and weekends.Additional InformationFull-time, salary positionThe starting annual salary for this position ranges from $50k to $85k. Actual pay rate will vary based on a candidate's location, qualifications, skills and experience.Paid time offHealth benefits and retirement plan availableFree gym membershipMovement is an Equal Opportunity Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status or marital status. Applications are now open for this position.

title: Fitness Manager
description: FITNESS MANAGERAre you a dynamic leader with sales, management, and coaching experience that wants to have a large impact in the fitness industry? Are you goal-oriented? Are you operations-minded? Are you driven and motivated? Do you like working with people?If this sounds like you, we'd love to have you on our team!CompensationOn target compensation: $95,000PTOEmployee DiscountsFree Staff MembershipCompetencies2+ years of demonstrated ability to lead and develop a team2+ years of demonstrated sales and operational excellence in a fitness/gym settingDemonstrated ability to improve sales & operationsDemonstrated ability to scale membership countObjectivesScale gym from 100 members to 350 membersHire a team of excellent sales associates and coachesLead, manage, and develop a team of coaches & sales associates to excellency in their rolesEnsure compliance with franchise rules and systemsAbout Sasquatch StrengthWe offer fun, strength-based group workouts led by coaches who actually care and help coach you through the other 23 hours of your day when you’re not at the gym. At Sasquatch, we know that strength training is the gateway to long term wellness; we know that good relationships are the precursor to long and fulfilling lives and we know that EVERYONE deserves the confidence that comes from feeling good in their own skin. That’s why we’ve designed a program that gives real, regular people what they need: results that last, confidence, and peace of mind knowing their health is “taken care of”. We also know that our members’ lives don’t begin and end in the gym, so we emphasize the importance of what they do in “the other 23” - all the hours that they aren’t with us in the gym. We want everyone to live longer, better lives and we know that "better" is different for everyone. That's why we make it our mission to get to know every member personally and find out WHY they are with us, so we can work together to find a path to their individual goals…because everyone deserves to feel strong.

title: Assistant Gym Director - Santa Clara
description: Job DetailsDescriptionAssistant Gym Director - Santa ClaraCome join a growing organization of Climbing | Yoga | Fitness gyms across the country! Movement’s mission is to Create Community, Share Passion, and Inspire Philanthropy. We are committed to the communities we serve and developing future leaders.Movement is committed to growing the climbing community through a shared vision for outstanding customer service, inspirational designs, and highly engaged communities. Movement gyms feature bouldering, top-roping and lead climbing, as well as amenities like yoga studios, functional fitness and cardio zones and retail pro shops. Each facility caters to participants of all abilities – from competitive athletes to weekend adventurers and families.Presently, Movement is represented in greater Washington D.C., San Francisco, Denver, Chicago, Dallas, Fountain Valley, and Portland. We are looking to build an extraordinary team to enable our continued growth and strive to hire individuals who are aligned with our core values of passion, integrity, respect, partnership and inclusion.Job SummaryThe gym leadership team is comprised of the Assistant Gym Director and Gym Director. all staffManagement and mentorship of staffOverseeing the delivery of excellent front-line customer serviceAbility to connect with diverse groups of people from all social and economic segments of the
